comment.author: 8139976@N03
comment._content: Nicholas M. Butler (1862-1947), President of Columbia University from 1901-1945: (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicholas_Murray_Butler) George L. Rives (1849-1917), well-known lawyer, Assistant Secretary of State 1887-1889; from 1903 to his death in 1917 he served as Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Columbia University. (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_L._Rives)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content:
NYT of Jan 10. 1916

announced that Butler would speak on 1/13/1916 at a General Assembly of Columbia University in honor of delegates at the Pan-American Scientific Congress.  That sounds like an opportunity to parade in academic dress.

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: Thanks, we'll update.  And who doesn't enjoy parading in academic dress?
